programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: After a shocking elimination, both teams must regroup and chart a new course.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs use cookbooks from Gordon's library to spell out the ingredients for their next challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Hell's Kitchen is hosting the International Ballroom Invitational and the contestants prepare a special menu.

programme.desc: A blind taste test during which each team must determine the taste of pureed baby foods.

programme.desc: The chefs are challenged to make sliders for three burger aficionados.

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay introduces a series of three challenges that will determine the recipients of black jackets.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches you how to get started cooking amazing food with confidence. Recipes include delicious pork chops with sweet and sour peppers, pan-fried scallops with crunchy apple salad and a tip that will help you keep your knives sharp.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us how to cook with chilli. Recipes include red mullet with sweet chilli sauce, classic jerk chicken and a super simple spicy beef salad.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and the boys reminisce about the early days and the importance of chicken to the opening of their business.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula and the boys continue to reminisce with some Mac and Cheese, a delicious Cucumber Salad and Paula's famous Banana Pudding.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Bobby Deen stops by and Paula prepares his favorite all-time meal!

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Dumplings are a mainstay in nearly every cuisine around the world. Watch Martha make Italian dumplings gnocchi and gnudi; plus, her family recipe for Polish pierogi.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Whole grains are an integral part of a healthy lifestyle. Martha provides an overview of grains and the different cooking methods for polenta, bulgur, quinoa, and farro.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha discusses two of the oldest preserving techniques, confit and salting, and how to use them at home: duck confit, tomato confit, and gravlax, a cured salmon appetizer.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shows you how easy it is to make fresh pasta at home. Cheese ravioli with a rich sage butter sauce; gluten-free pasta with pancetta and marinara sauce.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shares his savory wild mushroom ragout over creamy stone-ground grits. Plus, Emeril's rich and delicious porcini risotto with truffle oil.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.sub-title: Coffee: Sneaky Flavor Enhancer in Savory Dishes
programme.desc: Emeril prepares coffee infused recipes: short ribs, ancho chiles with Parmesan polenta, and espresso and cocoa rubbed flank steak with blood orange and plum salad.

programme.desc: We make two favorites in a cast-iron skillet: pizza and a giant chocolate chip cookie.

programme.desc: We make California-style garlic fried chicken and unforgettable crispy Parmesan potatoes.
